A, D
https://docs.oracle.com/en/database/oracle/oracle-database/12.2/lnpls/ACCESSIBLE-BY-clause.html#GUID-9720619C-9862-4123-96E7-3E85F240FF36
"The ACCESSIBLE BY clause allows access only when the call is direct. The check will fail if the access is through static SQL, DBMS_SQL, or dynamic SQL."

choices.A: It can be used in the declaration of object types.
choices.C: The check is enforced by this clause for direct access and access through dynamic SQL.
choices.B: It must be specified in the heading of a package specification.
choices.D: It can be used for individual procedures and functions declared in a package specification.
choices.E: It must be specified in the heading of a package body.

questions.question_text: Which two are true about using the ACCESSIBLE BY clause? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: DE
D, E ARE THE TRUE

If any function-based indexes depend on the function, then the database marks the indexes DISABLED.


If any function-based indexes depend on the function, then the database marks the indexes DISABLED.

choices.C: This clause can be used only for procedures and functions.
choices.E: Object privileges to execute a replaced function are retained by those users who had the privileges.
choices.B: Object privileges to execute a replaced function must be regranted to those users who had the privilege.
choices.A: Function based indexes remain usable when replacing the function on which the index depends.
choices.D: A function definition can be modified without dropping and re-creating it.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true about using the OR REPLACE clause when creating named subprograms? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Error in inner block Error in calling block
choices.D: Error in inner block Error in outer block Error in calling block
choices.B: Error in inner block Error in outer block

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
the answer is (A).
